content:
• Tuesday, July 24, 2012
  • TPX

    More on Tempur-Pedic (NYSE:TPX): Q2 beats despite the fact that profit slumped in the quarter,...

    More on Tempur-Pedic (NYSE:TPX): Q2 beats despite the fact that profit slumped in the quarter, as the mattress maker deals with a deeply competitive climate in its North American business. Still, shares are higher in the post session as both earnings and revenue declined less than the 50% the company had predicted in a dismal forecast issued last month. The company also ups its earnings forecast for the year, now expecting to $2.80 per share, reflecting a lower share count due to recent share repurchases. Shares +8.8% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:02 PM
  • PNRA

    More on Panera Bread (NASDAQ:PNRA): Q2 hits on all cylinders again as the restaurant chain beats...

    More on Panera Bread (NASDAQ:PNRA): Q2 hits on all cylinders again as the restaurant chain beats across the board. Net earnings rose 24% Y/Y, as same-store sales rose a better-than-expected 7.1% at company-owned restaurants and 4.8% at its franchises, and profit margins improved. The company ups its FY12 guidance to a range of $5.72 - $5.78 per share, above Street consensus EPS estimates of $5.69. Shares +6.4% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:39 PM
  • OMI

    Owens & Minor (NYSE:OMI) -4.6% AH after forecasting lower annual growth than previous...

    Owens & Minor (NYSE:OMI) -4.6% AH after forecasting lower annual growth than previous guidance of 3%-5%. The medical supplies distributor sees 2012 revenue of $8.95B, a 3.7% increase, and EPS of $1.98-$2.04 vs. analyst consensus of $2.01.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:16 PM
  • CY

    Ramtron (RMTR) -12.4% AH to $2.47 after reporting Q2 revenue of $14.2M and breakeven EPS, below...

    Ramtron (RMTR) -12.4% AH to $2.47 after reporting Q2 revenue of $14.2M and breakeven EPS, below a consensus of $17.4M and $0.04. The FRAM pioneer is also guiding for Q3 revenue of $14M-$14.5M, far below a consensus of $21.2M. The AH decline puts Ramtron shares well below Cypress Semiconductor's (NASDAQ:CY) $2.68/share tender offer, which Ramtron has rejected. The Street apparently thinks Cypress will now revise its offer, which expires on August 3, if not cancel its bid.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:40 PM
  • ACOM

    Ancestry.com (NASDAQ:ACOM) +19.3% AH after NYT's Dealbook reports the genealogy website is...

    Ancestry.com (NASDAQ:ACOM) +19.3% AH after NYT's Dealbook reports the genealogy website is closing in on a sale to take itself private. Though final bids are not due until early August, recent discussions have centered on prices in the mid-to-upper 30s, according to the story; shares closed today at $27.23.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:19 PM
  • UIS

    Unisys (NYSE:UIS): Q2 EPS of $0.99 may not be comparable to consensus of $0.47. Revenue of...

    Unisys (NYSE:UIS): Q2 EPS of $0.99 may not be comparable to consensus of $0.47. Revenue of $921.3M (-1.7% Y/Y) beats by $9M. Shares +8.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:18 PM | 1 Comment
  • FFIV

    More on Juniper and Riverbed's partnership: Juniper will license Riverbed's application delivery...

    More on Juniper and Riverbed's partnership: Juniper will license Riverbed's application delivery controller (ADC) technology for $75M, and the companies will collaborate on WAN optimization and mobile app acceleration solutions. The partnership is a challenge to ADC leader F5 (NASDAQ:FFIV). JNPR +4.6% and RVBD +23.4% following the companies' Q2 reports (I, II).  Riverbed is guiding for Q3 revenue of $214M-$219M and EPS of $0.25-$0.26, above a consensus of $210.4M and $0.24.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:16 PM
  • MITK

    Mitek Systems (NASDAQ:MITK): Q2 EPS of -$0.05 misses by $0.02. Revenue of $3.2M (+7% Y/Y) misses...

    Mitek Systems (NASDAQ:MITK): Q2 EPS of -$0.05 misses by $0.02. Revenue of $3.2M (+7% Y/Y) misses by $0.17M. Shares -1.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:11 PM | 1 Comment
  • TRIP

    More on TripAdvisor (NASDAQ:TRIP): Q2 results hit consensus on EPS but misses slightly on...

    More on TripAdvisor (NASDAQ:TRIP): Q2 results hit consensus on EPS but misses slightly on revenue. Analysts had been looking for an improvement to revenue due to reinvestment, hurting margins temporarily but holding per share earnings solid. Q2's EPS matches the Street, but it's based on a slight improvement in adjusted margins to 49% versus Q1's 46% - suggesting the company held off on planned investments to keep its bottom-line healthy. Click-based ad revenue also slowed, increasing 13% for the current quarter compared to 20% in Q1. Shares -19.7% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:02 PM
  • QCOM

    On cue, Apple component suppliers dive thanks to the company's FQ3 miss, which included an...

    On cue, Apple component suppliers dive thanks to the company's FQ3 miss, which included an iPhone shortfall. QCOM -1.6%. OVTI -3.2%. CRUS -6.3%. SWKS -3.1%. TQNT -1.8%. AVGO -2%. BRCM +2.8% after being up 5% following its Q2 beat.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:54 PM | 3 Comments
  • AFL

    More on Aflac (NYSE:AFL): Operating earnings rose 3.9% Y/Y, 3.2% if taking out the effect of the...

    More on Aflac (NYSE:AFL): Operating earnings rose 3.9% Y/Y, 3.2% if taking out the effect of the stronger yen. Aflac Japan revenue +9.2%, U.S. revenue +5.2%. Annualized ROE of 13.9%. The company guides towards the lower end of 2012 EPS of $6.45-6.52, thanks to the continued low level of investment yields. Shares -1.7% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:42 PM
  • TRIP

    Tripadvisor (NASDAQ:TRIP): Q2 EPS of $0.41 in-line. Revenue of $197.1M (+16.5% Y/Y) misses by...

    Tripadvisor (NASDAQ:TRIP): Q2 EPS of $0.41 in-line. Revenue of $197.1M (+16.5% Y/Y) misses by $5M. Shares -20% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:40 PM | 1 Comment
  • AAPL

    Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL): FQ3 EPS of $9.32 misses by $1.04. Revenue of $35B (+22% Y/Y) misses by...

    Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL): FQ3 EPS of $9.32 misses by $1.04. Revenue of $35B (+22% Y/Y) misses by $2.5B. 26M iPhones sold, 17M iPads, 4M Macs. Shares -5.5% AH. (PR).
     
     
     
     
    | 4:34 PM | 90 Comments
  • TSS

    Total System Services (NYSE:TSS): Q2 EPS of $0.35 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $462.7M (+3.4% Y/Y)...

    Total System Services (NYSE:TSS): Q2 EPS of $0.35 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $462.7M (+3.4% Y/Y) in-line. Shares +1.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:31 PM
  • BWLD

    More on Buffalo Wild Wings (BWLD): Shares are swooning in after-hours trading following a...

    More on Buffalo Wild Wings (BWLD): Shares are swooning in after-hours trading following a disappointing Q2 earnings report. Net earnings actually increased 9.3% Y/Y on a 5.3% increase in same-store sales at company-owned restaurants and 5.5% at its franchises, but it wasn't enough to match overreaching Street expectations. Looking forward, the company sees FY12 net earnings growth coming in between 15% - 20%. Shares -15.5% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:26 PM | 1 Comment
  • PLCM

    Polycom (NASDAQ:PLCM): Q2 EPS of $0.22 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $379M (+3.7% Y/Y) beats by...

    Polycom (NASDAQ:PLCM): Q2 EPS of $0.22 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $379M (+3.7% Y/Y) beats by $20M. Shares -1.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:25 PM
  • IGT

    International Game Technology (NYSE:IGT): FQ3 EPS of $0.23 misses by $0.05. Revenue of $533M...

    International Game Technology (NYSE:IGT): FQ3 EPS of $0.23 misses by $0.05. Revenue of $533M (+9% Y/Y) misses by $30M. Shares -2.6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:24 PM
  • EW

    Edwards Lifesciences (NYSE:EW): Q2 EPS of $0.67 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $482M (+11.8% Y/Y)...

    Edwards Lifesciences (NYSE:EW): Q2 EPS of $0.67 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $482M (+11.8% Y/Y) misses by $6M. Shares -1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:23 PM
  • TPX

    Tempur-pedic International (NYSE:TPX): Q2 EPS of $0.45 beats by $0.13. Revenue of $329.5M (-3.7%...

    Tempur-pedic International (NYSE:TPX): Q2 EPS of $0.45 beats by $0.13. Revenue of $329.5M (-3.7% Y/Y) beats by $2M. Shares +10.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:21 PM | 1 Comment
  • RVBD

    More on Juniper's Q2: The company is guiding for Q3 revenue of $1.04B-$1.075B and EPS of...

    More on Juniper's Q2: The company is guiding for Q3 revenue of $1.04B-$1.075B and EPS of $0.15-$0.18, below a consensus of $1.11B and $0.21. But that's better than many feared given industry conditions and competitive challenges. $94M worth of shares repurchased. Product revenue -10% Y/Y, service revenue (fueled by product sales) +17%. Routers -18%, switches +19%, security/other flat. New partnership formed with Riverbed (NASDAQ:RVBD). JNPR +5.8% AH. RVBD +13.5%. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:21 PM
  • NSC

    Norfolk Southern (NYSE:NSC): Q2 EPS of $1.60 beats by $0.08. Revenue of $2.87B (+0.3% Y/Y)...

    Norfolk Southern (NYSE:NSC): Q2 EPS of $1.60 beats by $0.08. Revenue of $2.87B (+0.3% Y/Y) misses by $80M. Shares +1.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:19 PM
  • NFLX

    More from the Netflix (NASDAQ:NFLX) Q2: expects Q3 EPS of -$0.10 to $0.14 vs. $0.11. Guides...

    More from the Netflix (NASDAQ:NFLX) Q2: expects Q3 EPS of -$0.10 to $0.14 vs. $0.11. Guides lower for net domestic subscription additions this quarter in part due to Olympics. Domestic streaming sub additions of 530K to total 23.94M; international stream sub additions of 560K to total 3.62M. Domestic DVD net subscription losses of 850K, bringing those subs to 9.24M. Shares -14.3% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:18 PM | 7 Comments
  • RVBD

    Riverbed Technology (NASDAQ:RVBD): Q2 EPS of $0.23 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $199M (+16.5% Y/Y)...

    Riverbed Technology (NASDAQ:RVBD): Q2 EPS of $0.23 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $199M (+16.5% Y/Y) beats by $5M. Shares +15% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:18 PM
  • AVGO

    Broadcom (BRCM): Q2 EPS of $0.72 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $1.97B (+10% Y/Y) beats by $20M....

    Broadcom (BRCM): Q2 EPS of $0.72 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $1.97B (+10% Y/Y) beats by $20M. Expects Q3 revenue of $2B-$2.15B vs. $2.11B consensus. Shares +5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:10 PM
  • PNRA

    Panera Bread (NASDAQ:PNRA): Q2 EPS of $1.50 beats by $0.07. Revenue of $531M (+18% Y/Y) beats by...

    Panera Bread (NASDAQ:PNRA): Q2 EPS of $1.50 beats by $0.07. Revenue of $531M (+18% Y/Y) beats by $13M. Shares +5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:09 PM | 1 Comment
  • NFLX

    Netflix (NASDAQ:NFLX): Q2 EPS of $0.11 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $889M (+12.7% Y/Y) in-line....

    Netflix (NASDAQ:NFLX): Q2 EPS of $0.11 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $889M (+12.7% Y/Y) in-line. Shares -13.7% AH. (release)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:09 PM | 2 Comments
  • BWLD

    Buffalo Wild Wings (BWLD): Q2 EPS of $0.62 misses by $0.06. Revenue of $238.7M misses by $1.2M....

    Buffalo Wild Wings (BWLD): Q2 EPS of $0.62 misses by $0.06. Revenue of $238.7M misses by $1.2M. Shares -13% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:05 PM
  • UPS

    UPS (UPS -4.6%) stock is down big after the company warned of a slowing global economy (I, II),...

    UPS (UPS -4.6%) stock is down big after the company warned of a slowing global economy (I, II), and shares may fall further. Citi trims its profit estimate for 2012 and 2013 and its 12-month target price, to $86 from $92; while UPS guidance is "a bit conservative, we see little pointing to a meaningful acceleration in volumes before the fourth quarter."

     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM | 3 Comments
  • D

    Shares of Ryder System (D +5.8%) buck a weak tape today after posting a mixed Q2 but raising its...

    Shares of Ryder System (D +5.8%) buck a weak tape today after posting a mixed Q2 but raising its outlook to the high-end of consensus estimates. The company now sees Q3 adjusted EPS coming in at $1.15 - $1.22 per share, and FY12 earnings of $3.75 - $3.90, versus Street EPS expectations of $1.17 and $3.76 respectively.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM | 1 Comment
  • STRI

    STR Holdings (STRI -15.5%) plunges after saying yesterday that its Q2 would be lower than...

    STR Holdings (STRI -15.5%) plunges after saying yesterday that its Q2 would be lower than consensus estimates. Craig-Hallum cut the shares to Hold on the news and reduced its price target to $5 from $7, saying market conditions aren't likely to improve over the near-term.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:20 PM
  • AME

    Shares of Ametek (AME -7.8%) slip after its Q2 fell short of Street projections this morning,...

    Shares of Ametek (AME -7.8%) slip after its Q2 fell short of Street projections this morning, despite a 21% Y/Y jump in net profit. Sales at the company's electronic instruments group rose 11%, while electromechanical group sales grew 6%, but it wasn't enough to meet revenue expectations. The company also boosted Q3 and FY12 revenue estimates, but both numbers still came in at the low end of expectations.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:00 PM
  • GRMN

    Garmin (GRMN +3.6%) is delivering a healthy gain on a down day, thanks to rival TomTom's...

    Garmin (GRMN +3.6%) is delivering a healthy gain on a down day, thanks to rival TomTom's (TMOAF.PK +10.8%) better-than-expected Q2 report. While revenue fell 17% Y/Y and consumer navigation device sales dropped 26%, TomTom, which is heavily exposed to Europe, reiterated its 2012 revenue and EPS guidance. 14.1% of Garmin's float was shorted as of June 29.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:51 PM
  • CLGX

    CoreLogic (CLGX +11.6%) shatters its 52-week high after the provider of mortgage and real estate...

    CoreLogic (CLGX +11.6%) shatters its 52-week high after the provider of mortgage and real estate information again beat expectations for its Q2 results, helped by a 28.5% jump in revenue from its mortgage origination services business fueled mostly by the impact of increased demand for credit and tax services.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:43 PM
  • BRKR

    Bruker Corp. (BRKR -13.9%) is among the day's biggest losers after issuing downside guidance for...

    Bruker Corp. (BRKR -13.9%) is among the day's biggest losers after issuing downside guidance for Q2, seeing EPS of $0.11-$0.13 vs. $0.21 analyst consensus and revenues of $420M vs. $434.6M consensus. BRKR says results are adversely impacted by a weaker euro, softening customer demand and an increase in spending.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:26 PM
  • DNDN

    In addition to rumors of Dendreon (DNDN +5%) looking to sell itself, the stock also appears to...

    In addition to rumors of Dendreon (DNDN +5%) looking to sell itself, the stock also appears to be reacting to Provenge's recent inclusion on the European Medicines Agencies XEVMPD, a medicinal products dictionary that outlines a drug's basic product details. Submission of product data to the XEVMPD is now mandatory for all drugs registered in the European Union.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:04 PM
  • VC

    Auto-parts provider Visteon (VC -3.4%) fails in its ~$800M tender offer for the 30% it doesn't...

    Auto-parts provider Visteon (VC -3.4%) fails in its ~$800M tender offer for the 30% it doesn't own in South Korea's Halla Climate Control, a provider of car air conditioners. The main problem was that Visteon couldn't persuade Halla's second-biggest shareholder, National Pension Service, to take part in the tender.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:50 PM
  • BYD

    Boyd Gaming (BYD -13%) takes a hit after its less-than-stellar 2Q results missed Street...

    Boyd Gaming (BYD -13%) takes a hit after its less-than-stellar 2Q results missed Street estimates earlier today. Net revenues in its Nevada gaming properties declined again, -4% Y/Y. The company blames a slowing economy and cautious consumer, which continues a trend that in turn has pushed the stock to its lowest levels of the year.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:46 PM
  • CNC

    Centene (NYSE:CNC) +7.2% despite swinging to a Q2 loss of $35M from a profit of $28.4M a year...

    Centene (NYSE:CNC) +7.2% despite swinging to a Q2 loss of $35M from a profit of $28.4M a year earlier, EPS missing expectations, and an increased medical-loss ratio of 92.9%. However, the company forecast it  would return to profit in Q3 and it maintained its FY EPS outlook.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:19 PM
  • SIX

    Shares of theme-park operator Six Flags (SIX +7.4%) ride higher as the company easily beats Q2...

    Shares of theme-park operator Six Flags (SIX +7.4%) ride higher as the company easily beats Q2 estimates. Total revenue rose 10% Y/Y on a surge in attendance. Spending per customer's visitor was off slightly with lower season-ticket prices cutting into per-person admission revenue, but deferred revenue rose 22% due to the efforts. The stock has been on a summer tear, gaining over 20% since early June.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:15 PM
  • FSYS

    Fuel Systems (FSYS +8.1%) surges after it's learned Kevin Douglas has bought another 69,800...

    Fuel Systems (FSYS +8.1%) surges after it's learned Kevin Douglas has bought another 69,800 shares of the company, thereby adding to his 10%+ stake. 13.2% of Fuel Systems' float was shorted as of June 29. (Form 4)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:57 PM
  • BP

    Despite the news of Rosneft's interest, BP's (BP -1.6%) shares are down, indicating that...

    Despite the news of Rosneft's interest, BP's (BP -1.6%) shares are down, indicating that investors know the pieces on BP's Russian board are still far from settling. Selling to Rosneft could net a better price than the risible $10B AAR is offering, but BP has a delicate strategic game to play, WSJ's Andrew Peaple points out.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM | 1 Comment
  • BIDU

    Beaten down on macro and mobile worries, Baidu (BIDU +10%) is rallying strongly after its Q2...

    Beaten down on macro and mobile worries, Baidu (BIDU +10%) is rallying strongly after its Q2 report and Q3 guidance made it clear that the Chinese search giant's growth remains quite healthy for now. Barclays (Overweight) sees the report, which featured a major increase in ad revenue/customer, as evidence of the untapped opportunity presented by Chinese SMEs. Multiple analysts note the strength of Baidu's display ad sales to third-party sites. SINA +1.7%. (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:29 PM
  • SFD

    The grain rally falls off the tracks as both corn (down $0.40) and beans (down $0.70) are locked...

    The grain rally falls off the tracks as both corn (down $0.40) and beans (down $0.70) are locked limit down at the CBOT.  At $7.74 bushel, corn is off 5% on the session. Wheat isn't yet limit down, but is off 6.3%. Smithfield (NYSE:SFD) hurriedly revisits its decision. JJG -5.5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:29 PM | 1 Comment
  • NSM

    Nationstar Mortgage (NSM -9.6%) plummets as Berkshire Hathaway (NYSE:BRK.B) emerges as the...

    Nationstar Mortgage (NSM -9.6%) plummets as Berkshire Hathaway (NYSE:BRK.B) emerges as the front-runner in the battle to buy not just ResCap's mortgage portfolio, but its entire operation, reports the NYPost. Nationstar - the mortgage arm of hedge fund giant Wesley Eden - had originally hoped to get all and then at least part of the package.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:16 PM | 2 Comments
  • GNTX

    Auto parts maker Gentex (GNTX -26%) crashes after a disappointing Q2 report earlier this...

    Auto parts maker Gentex (GNTX -26%) crashes after a disappointing Q2 report earlier this morning. Total revenue rose 15% Y/Y, but margins were compressed by sales price reductions and a poor product mix. The stock has been hammered all year, down over 50% since January due to a combination of lawsuits, weak European car sales, and the failure of of rear view camera legislation - of which GNTX is the largest supplier -  which would have required it to be installed in all vehicles. 

     
     
     
     
    | 12:15 PM
  • ALGT

    An appeals court upholds the authority of regulators to force new airline ticketing rules. One...

    An appeals court upholds the authority of regulators to force new airline ticketing rules. One is that carriers will have to prominently display the total price of a ticket in print ads, including taxes. The decision is a defeat for Allegiant (ALGT -2.2%), Southwest (LUV -2.1%) and Spirit (SAVE -1.9%). Many other airline stocks are down as well, with UAL -6.4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:03 PM | 3 Comments
  • KIOR

    KiOR (KIOR +3.8%) is granted Part 79 registration for its Renewable Gasoline Blendstock 5 by the...

    KiOR (KIOR +3.8%) is granted Part 79 registration for its Renewable Gasoline Blendstock 5 by the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency. KiOR says its product is the first renewable cellulosic gasoline the EPA has registered for sale in the U.S. The EPA requires the registration by manufacturers of motor vehicle fuels prior to sale of the product.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:55 AM
  • LXK

    11 days after hammering Lexmark (LXK -14.8%) on account of its Q2 warning, the Street is doing...

    11 days after hammering Lexmark (LXK -14.8%) on account of its Q2 warning, the Street is doing it again due to the guidance accompanying the actual report. Lexmark expects a 9%-11% Y/Y Q3 revenue drop and EPS of $0.75-$0.85, worse than a consensus of 7.1% and $0.98. The magnitude of the EPS miss suggests sales of high-margin printing supplies are especially under pressure (due to online/mobile photo sharing), as Goldman recently suggested. HPQ -1.6% in sympathy.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:48 AM
  • RSH

    UBS says Radioshack's (RSH -3.5%) poor fundamentals, management departures and questions over...

    UBS says Radioshack's (RSH -3.5%) poor fundamentals, management departures and questions over its strategic direction leave it with an uncertain capital outlook. It downgrades the shares to sell and lowers its price target to $3 from $4.40.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:38 AM
  • DNDN

    Dendreon (NASDAQ:DNDN) +6.9% - although down from earlier highs - on rumors it might be trying...

    Dendreon (NASDAQ:DNDN) +6.9% - although down from earlier highs - on rumors it might be trying to sell itself, with Celgene (CELG -0.2%) one name being mooted. Feeding the speculation beast is new CEO John Johnson working from New Jersey even though the company is based in Seattle.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:23 AM | 6 Comments
  • TMUS

    MetroPCS (PCS +6.1%) rallies on an upgrade to Outperform from Macquarie. The firm had downgraded...

    MetroPCS (PCS +6.1%) rallies on an upgrade to Outperform from Macquarie. The firm had downgraded the discount carrier in April on fears of competition from T-Mobile. But T-Mobile hasn't been a threat to anyone as of late. MetroPCS delivers its Q2 report on Thursday.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:21 AM
  • AVY

    More on Avery Dennison (NYSE:AVY) Q2: net profit -12% to $64.2M. Narrows FY EPS estimate to...

    More on Avery Dennison (NYSE:AVY) Q2: net profit -12% to $64.2M. Narrows FY EPS estimate to $1.90-2.05 from $1.80-2.15 prior, vs. consensus of $1.96. Started restructuring program that will bring $100M in annualized savings, although will take charges of $55M this year and $25M in 2013. Shares +8.75% for some reason.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:58 AM
  • CAT

    Caterpillar's (CAT +1%) 3-month retail-sales data show that while North America continues to...

    Caterpillar's (CAT +1%) 3-month retail-sales data show that while North America continues to outpace other regions of the world, it's showing signs of weakening. For the U.S., growth slowed to 24% from 31% in the previous quarter, while the Asia/Pacific region rose 16% in 2Q versus a 5% rise for Q1. The overall report is being taken as a positive however, as concern over a slowdown in the Far East - China, specifically - has been the reason behind a slump in the stock recently after briefly surging at the beginning of the year.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:51 AM | 1 Comment
  • ITW

    More on Illinois Tool Works (ITW -3.3%) Q2: net profit jumps 77% to $881M, reflecting major...

    More on Illinois Tool Works (ITW -3.3%) Q2: net profit jumps 77% to $881M, reflecting major gains from discontinued operations. Cuts FY guidance, now predicts EPS of $4.03-4.19 on revenue growth of 1-3% vs. prior estimate of $4.14-4.38 and 5-7%. For FQ3, forecasts $1.03-1.11 on flat revenue vs. consensus of $1.10 and +5% to $4.83B.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:42 AM
  • NOW

    ServiceNow (NOW +5.1%) jumps on underwriter coverage day. Citi (Buy) praises ServiceNow's...

    ServiceNow (NOW +5.1%) jumps on underwriter coverage day. Citi (Buy) praises ServiceNow's differentiated, cloud-based approach to systems management software, and sees a giant untapped opportunity in IT services management (ITSM). Deutsche (Buy) sees potential in both ITSM and the company's cloud app development platform, which competes with Salesforce's Force.com. Morgan Stanley (Equal Weight), however, is cautious due to a steep valuation. (IPO gains)

Nicira has minimal sales right now, but its business model centers around eliminating proprietary Ethernet switches from the likes of Cisco and Juniper, and replacing them with commodity gear managed by Nicira's software. Cisco is working on a similar solution, but its main priority still remains selling its proprietary Nexus and Catalyst switches. (VMW transcript)
